Metadata: Chymotrypsin mRNA expression in digestive gland amoebocytes: cell specification occurs prior to metamorphosis and gut morphogenesis in the gastropod, "Haliotis rufescens."

To ascertain how the initial signaling events that trigger larval metamorphosis are coupled to the global changes in gene regulation underlying cell specification and morphogenesis, the authors examine tissue-specific gene expression induced at metamorphosis in the gastropod "Haliotis rufescens" (red abalone). Analysis of mRNA accumulation in larvae and during metamorphosis reveals that chymotrypsin gene expression begins in a small population of larval digestive gland amoebocytes prior to metamorphosis and gut morphogenesis. Completion of the gut morphogenetic program then requires signaling events associated with metamorphosis.
